value.title: It's time to free your Power BI data model! We freed up 83%!?!
value.excerpt: We reduced a Power BI dataset size by 83% by doing one simple thing. It's time to get serious about your data model! value.title: LEVEL UP Power BI Conditional Drill with Paginated reports!
value.excerpt: Take Power BI Conditional Drill to the next level by incorporating Paginated reports with your strategy! Patrick shows a customer scenario that he solved using this approach.  Paginated reports doc: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/paginated-reports/paginated-reports-report-builder-power-bi  Power

value.title: Measuring RLS Performance in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you tried measuring performance of Row-Level Security (RLS) in Power BI? How much overhead does it have? That can be a challenge using the tools we talk about. Adam shows you how you can do it!  RLS Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLv2BtOtLblH1dBK34FqClo2eXXQgWW1ui  RLS Course: https://guyinacu.be/rlscourse

value.title: Microsoft R, Data Science and Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, we are joined by Buck Woody. Buck is a data scientist at Microsoft. We work together to show how you can easily visualize Microsoft R in Power BI. We use Microsoft R Open and then move onto Power BI Desktop.  The example used in Microsoft R Open is the Anscombe's quartet.   Download sample

value.title: Migrate your Paginated reports to Power BI
value.excerpt: Are your paginated reports still on-premises with either Power BI Report Server or SQL Server Reporting Services? Want to move them to Power BI? Patrick shows you how you can do that using the RDLMigration tool!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/migrate-ssrs-reports-to-power-bi
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/_VaBzheAgxY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: OData Differences within Power BI and how to refresh your data!
value.excerpt: Last week we looked at the O365 Bubble and how we use Authentication to go in and out.  This week we show it in action!  We will look at one of the limitations to the existing Power BI service and how we can actually use the new Power BI Preview service to refresh data from an OData feed using oAuth

value.title: One little change to improve Power BI slicer performance (BANANAS!!!)

value.title: Personal Gateway governance in Power BI
value.excerpt: Gateway sprawl in Power BI can be a problem for organizations looking to govern what data can be refreshed. Learn how you can govern the Personal Gateway to keep it under control.  Set-DataGatewayTenantPolicy PowerShell Reference https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/module/datagateway/set-datagatewaytenantpolicy?view=datagateway-ps

value.title: Power BI Auditing
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at the Power BI Auditing feature that was made available a few weeks ago. I show how to turn it on and how to search. This can be helpful with understanding who is doing what within your organization.  Offical Docs: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-admin-auditing/

value.title: Power BI dataflows: One thing you probably missed with your gateway
value.excerpt: Adam looks at how you can get your gateway working with Power BI dataflows, even if you aren't an admin of the gateway. There is one thing that most people overlook. value.title: Power BI Desktop: How to find the native query after query folding
value.excerpt: Have you wondered how to find the native query in Power BI Desktop after query folding does its thing? Do you even know what query folding is? In this video, Adam looks at how you can find the query that will be sent to your data source and a few things to be aware of. This applies to Power Query in

value.title: Power BI Drillthrough Updates
value.excerpt: Did you know there were Power BI drillthrough updates? In this video, Patrick looks at the drillthrough updates in Power BI Desktop. This includes Keep All Filters which will pass the filters on your parent page to the drillthrough page.   LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI Embed Token Using Powershell
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam shows an easier approach to get a Power BI Embed Token using PowerShell. This removes the headache of writing code or having to worry about an authentication token.   Power BI Embedded Playground https://microsoft.github.io/PowerBI-JavaScript/demo/  Invoke-PowerBIRestMethod Documentation

value.title: Power BI For Report Consumers
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Now that you have data, Patrick walks you through how to build a matrix visual within the report. value.title: Power BI Publish to Web can be SCARY!?!

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: How to Sign up
value.excerpt: Do you want to get started using Power BI? After getting Power BI Desktop, you will want to sign up for the Power BI service. In this video, we show you how to do just that! value.title: Power BI User lookup with the gateway using Active Directory
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can use Active Directory custom attributes for the user lookup with the Power BI Gateway. This can be used for both Analysis Services mapping and the Kerberos SSO with DirectQuery connections.  Manage your data source - Analysis Services https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-enterprise-manage-ssas#usernames-with-analysis-services

value.title: Power Query! Uggg - Where do you start? | Power BI

value.title: Row-Level Security in Power BI - Revisited

value.title: Slicer Restatement in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at a small feature called slicer restatement in Power BI. This feature will help you to determine what was selected in a slicer. While this feature was added back in April 2018, we are betting that most folks don't know slicer restatement.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube --
